content:
TITLE: Validating Handle Format Rules in AT Protocol
DESCRIPTION: Lists examples of valid handle formats that follow the AT Protocol rules. Valid handles can include uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, hyphens, and dots, with specific patterns for domain names.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/atidentifier_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
XX.LCS.MIT.EDU
john.test
jan.test
a234567890123456789.test
john2.test
john-john.test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating DID Format Rules in AT Protocol
DESCRIPTION: Lists examples of valid DID (Decentralized Identifier) formats that follow the AT Protocol rules. Valid DIDs start with 'did:' followed by a method name and a value that can contain letters, numbers, and hyphens.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/atidentifier_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
did:method:val
did:method:VAL
did:method:val123
did:method:123
did:method:val-two
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Preferred ISO 8601 Date and Time Formats
DESCRIPTION: Examples of preferred ISO 8601 date and time formats, including variations with different fractional second precisions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.000Z
2000-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123456Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.120Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.120000Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Valid NSID Examples
DESCRIPTION: Standard valid NSID formats including alphanumeric segments, version numbers, and multi-level namespaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
com.example.fooBar
com.example.fooBarV2
net.users.bob.ping
a.b.c
m.xn--masekowski-d0b.pl
one.two.three
one.two.three.four-and.FiVe
one.2.three
a-0.b-1.c
a0.b1.cc
cn.8.lex.stuff
test.12345.record
a01.thing.record
a.0.c
xn--fiqs8s.xn--fiqa61au8b7zsevnm8ak20mc4a87e.record.two
a0.b1.c3
com.example.f00
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example ATProto URI Formats for Basic Specification Compliance
DESCRIPTION: Examples of valid ATProto URIs demonstrating the four main format patterns: DID-only, domain handle, collection reference, and record reference. These examples ensure compliance with the basic ATProto URI specification.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123
at://user.bsky.social
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/record
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Supported ISO 8601 Date and Time Formats
DESCRIPTION: Examples of supported ISO 8601 date and time formats, including variations with different precisions, timezone offsets, and year representations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
1985-04-12T23:20:50.1235678912345Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.100Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.0Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+00:00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123-07:00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+07:00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+01:45
0985-04-12T23:20:50.123-07:00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123-07:00
0123-01-01T00:00:00.000Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: NSID Length Test Cases
DESCRIPTION: Examples demonstrating maximum length constraints and segment length validation for NSIDs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
com.ooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo.foo
com.example.ooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo
com.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.foo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of ATProto URI with Strict Path Format
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the strict path format for ATProto URIs with a specific record identifier. The format follows the pattern of DID, collection identifier (NSID), and record key.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/asdf123
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ISO 8601 Date and Time Formats with Various Precisions
DESCRIPTION: Examples of ISO 8601 date and time formats with fractional second precisions ranging from 1 to 12 digits.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
1985-04-12T23:20:50.1Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.12Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.1234Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.12345Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123456Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.1234567Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.12345678Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123456789Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.1234567890Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.12345678901Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123456789012Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ATProto URI Examples Enforcing No Trailing Slashes
DESCRIPTION: Examples of correctly formatted ATProto URIs without trailing slashes. This demonstrates proper addressing at different levels: DID, domain, collection, and record.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123
at://user.bsky.social
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/record
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid ATProto Handles in Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: A list of invalid handle formats that should be rejected by ATProto validation functions. These test cases cover various syntax errors such as incorrect character usage, improper formatting, and internationalized domain name issues.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/atidentifier_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# invalid handles
did:thing.test
did:thing
john-.test
john.0
john.-
xn--bcher-.tld
john..test
jo_hn.test
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing 13-digit DID Handles in AT Protocol
DESCRIPTION: A set of test cases for 13-digit handles in the AT Protocol. These test cases include valid and potentially invalid handles to verify base32 encoding constraints and validation logic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
3jzfcijpj2z2a
7777777777777
3zzzzzzzzzzzz
2222222222222
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: AT Protocol Basic URI Format Tests
DESCRIPTION: Tests for validating basic AT Protocol URI format requirements including scheme, host, and path components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
a://did:plc:asdf123
at//did:plc:asdf123
at:/a/did:plc:asdf123
at:/did:plc:asdf123
AT://did:plc:asdf123
http://did:plc:asdf123
://did:plc:asdf123
at:did:plc:asdf123
at:/did:plc:asdf123
at:///did:plc:asdf123
at://:/did:plc:asdf123
at:/ /did:plc:asdf123
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Onion Address NSID Examples
DESCRIPTION: Examples of valid NSIDs using Tor onion addresses, demonstrating support for .onion domains in the namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
onion.expyuzz4wqqyqhjn.spec.getThing
onion.g2zyxa5ihm7nsggfxnu52rck2vv4rvmdlkiu3zzui5du4xyclen53wid.lex.deleteThing
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: ATProto URI Examples with Various Record Key Formats
DESCRIPTION: Collection of valid ATProto URIs demonstrating the permissive nature of record key formats. Examples include various characters, patterns, and formats that are acceptable in record keys.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/asdf123
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/a

at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/asdf-123
at://did:abc:123
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/record-key

at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/self.
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/lang:
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/:
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/-
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/_
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/~
at://did:abc:123/io.nsid.someFunc/...
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.postV2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Numeric Segment NSID Examples
DESCRIPTION: Examples showing valid NSIDs with numeric segments, demonstrating support for domains starting with numbers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
org.4chan.lex.getThing
cn.8.lex.stuff
onion.2gzyxa5ihm7nsggfxnu52rck2vv4rvmdlkiu3zzui5du4xyclen53wid.lex.deleteThing
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Invalid DID Formats in Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: A collection of malformed DID (Decentralized Identifier) strings that violate the DID syntax specification. These examples test validation for missing components, improper syntax, and invalid characters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/atidentifier_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# invalid DIDs
did
didmethodval
method:did:val
did:method:
didmethod:val
did:methodval)
:did:method:val
did:method:val:
did:method:val%
DID:method:val
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: AT Protocol URI Character and Length Validation
DESCRIPTION: Tests for URI character restrictions, length limits, and fragment handling in AT Protocol URIs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.p@st
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.p$st
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.p%st
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.p&st
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.p()t
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed_post
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Invalid DateTime Examples with Correct Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Examples of ISO-8601 datetime strings that appear syntactically valid but contain semantically invalid values like month 0, day 0, hour 25, minutes 99, etc. These test cases help verify proper datetime validation in ATProto implementations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_parse_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: text
CODE:
```
1985-00-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-00T23:20:50.123Z
1985-13-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T25:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:99:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:61.123Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing ISO-8601 Timestamp Format Variations
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive set of test cases for validating ISO-8601 timestamp formats, including case sensitivity, padding, timezone handling, and various invalid format patterns. Includes both valid and invalid examples to test format validation logic.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# subtle changes to: 1985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123z
01985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.Z
1985-04-32T23;20:50.123Z
1985-04-32T23;20:50.123Z

# en-dash and em-dash
1985â€”04-32T23;20:50.123Z
1985â€“04-32T23;20:50.123Z

# whitespace
 1985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z 
1985-04-12T 23:20:50.123Z

# not enough zero padding
1985-4-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-2T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T3:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:0:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:5.123Z

# too much zero padding
01985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-004-12T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-012T23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T023:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:020:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:050.123Z

# strict capitalization (ISO-8601)
1985-04-12t23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123z

# RFC-3339, but not ISO-8601
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123-00:00
1985-04-12_23:20:50.123Z
1985-04-12 23:20:50.123Z

# ISO-8601, but weird
1985-04-274T23:20:50.123Z

# timezone is required
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123
1985-04-12T23:20:50

1985-04-12
1985-04-12T23:20Z
1985-04-12T23:20:5Z
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123
+001985-04-12T23:20:50.123Z
23:20:50.123Z

1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+00:0
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+0:00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+0000
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+00
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123+
1985-04-12T23:20:50.123-

# ISO-8601, but normalizes to a negative time
0000-01-01T00:00:00+01:00
-000001-12-31T23:00:00.000Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating ATProto Namespace Length
DESCRIPTION: Test cases for checking the maximum length of ATProto namespace identifiers. These examples push the boundaries of allowed lengths for different parts of the namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
com.oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo.foo
com.example.oooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo
com.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.middle.foo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Non-Base32 Characters
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates invalid base32 strings containing numbers and repeated zeros.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# not base32
3jzfcijpj2z21
0000000000000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: AT Protocol Edge Case Tests
DESCRIPTION: Tests for handling edge cases like multiple slashes, empty segments, and invalid path components.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://user.bsky.social//
at://user.bsky.social//com.atproto.feed.post
at://user.bsky.social/com.atproto.feed.post//
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/asdf123/more/more
at://did:plc:asdf123/short/stuff
at://did:plc:asdf123/12345
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Extreme but Allowed ISO 8601 Date Formats
DESCRIPTION: Examples of ISO 8601 date formats that are considered extreme but currently allowed, including dates from very early years to the far future.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/datetime_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
0010-12-31T23:00:00.000Z
1000-12-31T23:00:00.000Z
1900-12-31T23:00:00.000Z
3001-12-31T23:00:00.000Z
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of Maximum Length ATProto Record URI
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a very long ATProto URI with an extended record key (512 'o' characters). This tests the upper bounds of record key length handling in the protocol.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Identifying Invalid ATProto Namespace Patterns
DESCRIPTION: Examples of invalid ATProto namespace identifiers, including use of wildcards, emojis, invalid characters, and incorrect formatting. These cases help test proper rejection of malformed namespaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/nsid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
com.example.foo.*
com.example.foo.blah*
com.example.foo.*blah
com.exaðŸ’©ple.thing
a-0.b-1.c-3
a-0.b-1.c-o
1.0.0.127.record
0two.example.foo
example.com
com.example
a.
.one.two.three
one.two.three 
one.two..three
one .two.three
 one.two.three
com.exaðŸ’©ple.thing
com.atproto.feed.p@st
com.atproto.feed.p_st
com.atproto.feed.p*st
com.atproto.feed.po#t
com.atproto.feed.p!ot
com.example-.foo
com.example.fooBar.2
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Path Traversal Prevention in ATProto URLs
DESCRIPTION: Examples specifically testing ATProto's handling of dot and double-dot path segments, which are commonly used for directory traversal attacks. These test cases ensure the protocol properly rejects such potentially dangerous patterns.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# disallow dot / double-dot
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/.
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/..
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Other Invalid Identifier Formats in Plaintext
DESCRIPTION: Additional test cases for invalid identifiers that don't fit into the handle or DID categories. These include email addresses, malformed handle references, and arbitrary strings that should be rejected by validation functions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/atidentifier_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# other invalid stuff
email@example.com
@handle@example.com
@handle
blah
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Case Sensitivity
DESCRIPTION: Shows an invalid base32 string using uppercase characters when lowercase is expected.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# case-sensitive
3JZFCIJPJ2Z2A
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Test Cases for Atproto Identifiers and Edge Cases
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines various test cases for atproto identifiers, including valid and invalid formats, special characters, and length limits. It covers handles, spaces, numbers, quotes, and base64 encoding.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/recordkey_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# specs
alpha/beta
.
..
#extra
@handle
any space
any+space
number[3]
number(3)
"quote"
dHJ1ZQ==

# too long: 'o'.repeat(513)

```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Fragment Handling in ATProto URLs
DESCRIPTION: Examples demonstrating how AT protocol handles fragment identifiers (#) in URLs. The test cases show that the protocol is very permissive with fragments, allowing them in various positions and combinations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# is very permissive about fragments
at://did:plc:asdf123#
at://did:plc:asdf123##
#at://did:plc:asdf123
at://did:plc:asdf123#/asdf#/asdf
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Record Key Validation in ATProto URLs
DESCRIPTION: Examples testing the constraints on record keys in ATProto URLs. These cases explore the boundaries of allowed characters and patterns in record keys for Lexicon use, showing both valid and invalid examples.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/aturi_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# new less permissive about record keys for Lexicon use (with recordkey more specified)
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%23
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/$@!*)(:,;~.sdf123
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/~'sdf123")
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/$
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/@
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/!
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/*
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/(
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/,
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/;
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/abc%30123
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%30
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%3
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%zz
at://did:plc:asdf123/com.atproto.feed.post/%%%
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Length Constraints
DESCRIPTION: Examples of base32 strings that violate length requirements, including strings that are too long or too short.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# too long/short
3jzfcijpj2z2aa
3jzfcijpj2z2
222
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Long URL in Python
DESCRIPTION: A Python code comment demonstrating how to generate a long URL by concatenating a base URL with a repeated character. The example shows how to create a URL with 5000 'x' characters appended to the base URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/uri_syntax_valid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
"https://example.com/" + 5000*"x"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Excessively Long URL in Python
DESCRIPTION: A Python code comment showing how to generate a URL that exceeds the maximum allowed length (8 KB) by concatenating a base URL with repeated characters.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/uri_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
"https://example.com/" + 8200 *"x"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Deprecated Dash Syntax
DESCRIPTION: Example of an invalid format using dashes in the TTTT-TTT-TTTT-CC pattern which is no longer supported.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# old dashes syntax not actually supported (TTTT-TTT-TTTT-CC)
3jzf-cij-pj2z-2a
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing High Bit Constraints
DESCRIPTION: Examples of invalid base32 strings where the high bit constraint is violated.
SOURCE: https://github.com/bluesky-social/atproto-interop-tests/blob/main/syntax/tid_syntax_invalid.txt#2025-04-23_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
# high bit can't be high
zzzzzzzzzzzzz
kjzfcijpj2z2a
```
